bibl.title: Despatch from Charles H. J. Taylor to James D. Porter, June 21, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate Series United States Consulate Genl Monrovia June 21st, 1887
Chas. H. J. Taylor to Hon. Jas. D. Porter
S. S. Sevier Contingent account fees rec'd official.
Hon Jas. D. Porter Ass't Secretary of State Wasington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you, that it will be necessary for the Government of the United States to retain of S.S. Sevier salary, at least $200.00 to make up for the "deficit" in his contingent and fee account as consular office for the first two months of this the second quarter. I have no hesitancy in informing you that he did a great many unauthorized and unwarranted "things" which will be reported at the end of this

quarter. Such as paing $20.00 for wine on acc't of some parade on the part of urchins in the Republic which account has been taken out of the Contingent allowance for this quarter. Also $50.00 for which there is no voucher present etc.
Desiring to serve the Department in an upright manner, I have the honor to be, sir, your most obedient servant.
P.S. He is now on his way to America I presume he will call at the State Department. I told him to do so.
